item.title: Courtney add a quote by Courtney King Walker
item.description: "I had the strange desire for a giant butterfly net to catch whatever was out there, as if it could be captured so easily." -- Courtney King Walker

item.title: Courtney add a quote by Courtney King Walker
item.description: "It looked like a ghost had dressed up the forest in tulle." -- Courtney King Walker

item.title: Courtney add a quote by Courtney King Walker
item.description: "Nothing could be purged without a bodyâ€”no crying, no exertion, no pills to take away the pain or calm me down. Nothing. Instead, something ballooned inside me until I felt like I might explode. All I could do was sit there and drown in it, wondering why Claire affected me so much, wondering if she always would." -- Courtney King Walker

item.title: Courtney add a quote by Gary D. Schmidt
item.description:
"You know, there are good reasons to learn how to read. Poetry isn't one of them. I mean, so what if two roads go two ways in a wood? So what? Who cares if it made all that big a difference? What difference? And why should I have to guess what the difference is? Isn't that what he's supposed to say?
Why can't poets just say what they want to say and then shut up?" -- Gary D. Schmidt

item.title: Courtney add a quote by Gary D. Schmidt
item.description: "I almost cried. But I didn't, because if you're in seventh grade and you cry while wearing a blue floral cape and yellow tights with white feathers on the butt, you just have to curl up and die somewhere in a dark alley." -- Gary D. Schmidt

item.title: Courtney add a quote by Lauren Oliver
item.description: "(I)f you do not believe that hearts can bloom suddenly bigger, and that love can open like a flower out of even the hardest places, then I am afraid that for you the road will be long and brown and barren, and you will have trouble finding the light. But if you <i>do</i> believe, then you already know all about magic." -- Lauren Oliver

item.title: Courtney add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "Life isn't fair, it's just fairer than death, that's all." -- William Goldman

item.title: Courtney add a quote by Bob Smith
item.description: "It wasn't easy telling my family that I'm gay. I made my carefully worded announcement at Thanksgiving. It was very Norman Rockwell. I said, 'Mom, would you please pass the gravy to a homosexual?' She passed it to my father. A terrible scene followed." -- Bob Smith

item.title: Courtney add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Don't say you don't have enough time. You have exactly the same number of hours per day that were given to Helen Keller, Pasteur, Michaelangelo, Mother Teresa, Leonardo da Vinci, Thomas Jefferson, and Albert Einstein." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Courtney add a quote by H. Jackson Brown
item.description: "Remember that everyone you meet is afraid of something, loves something and has lost something." -- H. Jackson Brown

item.title: Courtney add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Every person that you meet knows something you don't; learn from them." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Courtney add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "I've learned... . That being kind is more important than being right." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.
